subject: RE: [junit] Continuous Hours of Stress/Operation Test
msgSnippet: ... /enhancedj ... extra ... indeed ... do ... No problem - Mike. I just wanted to be clear.
messageBody:
> From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> Michael Silverstein wrote:
>
> >JUnitPerf is a decorator that spawns the test across threads
> within a
> >single VM. Enhanced JUnit
> >(http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit/ ) hasa
> load testing
> >component that disburses the test across multiple threads, VMs and
> >machines, and graphs the response times in real time. For
> details, scan
> >down to the section on "Junit/load" in:
> >http://www.silvermark.com/Product/enhancedjunit/documentation
/enhancedj
>u
>nit.pdf. Which tool is appropriate depends on whether you need the
extra
>power or functionality that Enhanced JUnit provides, but they are
indeed
>very different tools.
>
> Apologies. I read Jason's question to ask if JUnitPerf could meet the

> poster's need, as well. I didn't mean to imply that JUnitPerf could
do
> everything that Enhanced JUnit does. JUnitPerf and Enhanced JUnit are
> very different tools, and Enhanced JUnit generally does more things.

No problem - Mike. I just wanted to be clear.
